title: Hurworth on Tees Walks

description: This riverside village is located just a few miles south of Darlington in County Durham. The village is a good place to start a walk with a number of footpaths and a noteworthy pub dating back to the 1400s. This circular walk from the village explores the surrounding countryside, visiting the neighbouring villages of Dalton-on-Tess and Croft-on-Tees. The route uses a section of the Teesdale Way which runs through the area. The route starts in the village and heads east along the river to Low Hail Bridge. Cross the river here and then head south along a bridle track to Eryholme Lane, passing Low Hail Farm on the way. Follow footpaths west and they will take you through Dalton Wood to Dalton-on-Tees. The next stage takes you north to Croft-on-Tees on the pavement next to the Northallerton Road. Cross the river here and head east through the farmland to return to Hurworth on Tees.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Back in the village the historic Bay Horse Inn is a nice place for some post exercise relaxation and refreshment. The former coaching inn dates back to the 15th century and includes a charming interior with original features combined with the modern. Outside there's a beautiful walled garden where you can relax on warmer days. They serve high quality food and can be found at 45 The Green with postcode DL2 2AA for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: For more walking ideas in the area see the County Durham Walks page.
